content.question: Let <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the graphs of <math alttext="y equals, the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator pi times x, and denominator 2, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>Ï€</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals, x squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved around the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.12: Volume with Washer Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
